original_question: Radioactive decay can give off energy and what else?
diverse_qns: What else can radioactive decay produce apart from energy?
Besides energy, what else is emitted during radioactive decay?
With energy being one of them, what are the other products of radioactive decay?
Apart from energy, can you tell me what else is given off by radioactive decay?
We know that energy is released during radioactive decay, but what else is?
Is energy the only thing released during radioactive decay or are there other things as well?
Energy is one byproduct of radioactive decay, can you name the others?
What is accompanied by energy during radioactive decay?
Radiactive decay results in energy and which other entities?
In addition to energy, what else can be a product of radioactive decay?
pred_ans: Radioactive decay can also produce radiation and release particles.
pred_ans_conf_MCQ: Radioactive decay can give off energy and particles
pred_ans_conf_NL_MCQ: Radioactive decay can give off energy and particles
pred_ans_conf_OE: Radioactive decay can give off energy and particles.
pred_diverse_ans: Radioactive decay can also produce particles such as electrons, protons, and neutrons.
Radioactive decay also emits particles such as electrons, protons, and neutrons, as well as gamma rays.
The other products of radioactive decay include gamma rays, alpha particles, beta particles, and electron neutrinos.
Yes, radioactive decay also emits particles such as electrons, protons, and neutrons, as well as gamma rays.
No, energy is not the only thing released during radioactive decay. Other things such as particles and radiation are also released.
Yes, the other byproducts of radioactive decay include gamma rays, alpha particles, beta particles, and electron neutrinos.
Radioactive decay is accompanied by the release of energy in the form of gamma rays, alpha particles, or beta particles.
Radiative decay results in energy and the emission of particles or photons.
Radioactive decay can also produce particles such as electrons, protons, and neutrons, as well as gamma rays and other forms of radiation.
